description: Use of dance studios as extension to existing day nursery between the hours of 8am to 6pm Monday to Friday
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan 2001/01/2A shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site. | The use permitted shall not operate outside the hours of  8am to 6pm Monday to Friday and not at any time on Saturdays or Sundays or Bank Holidays.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties. | Details shall be submitted for approval to the Local Planning Authority for a suitable mechanical ventilation system, to ensure doors and windows are kept closed during hot weather. The plant associated with this system will be silenced to a standard not exceeding *NR 40 Leq (1hr) (0700-2300Hrs), measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises. These details shall be approved in writing and installed as approved, before the use commences and be permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties. | Details shall be submitted to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR40Leq1hr 0700-2300hrs Mondays to Fridays, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises. No machinery shall be installed if it fails to meet this requirement. All machinery shall be maintained to meet this standard continually.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of the neighbouring properties. | Details of the Kitchen extract ducting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and installed as approved before the use commences and be permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | There shall be no more than 57 children attending the nursery at any one time.  Reason: To ensure that there is no future increase in the size of the nursery in order to protect the living conditions of nearby residents. | The doors and windows of the premises shall be kept closed when the nursery is open.  Reason: to protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties. | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority showing ramped access to the front entrance of the nursery. These details shall be approved in writing and constructed as approved, before the use commences and be permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that the property is accessible. | The existing covered area within the proposed external play area shall not be used for storage of any items other than those directly connected with and in use for the nursery use.  REASON:  To ensure an adequate and safe external play space for the children at the nursery. | The external play space shall be used by no more than 15 children at any one time.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers. | The area shown on the approved plans as marked for dual use shall not be used concurrently as a dance studio and a nursery.  REASON:  To ensure a safe environment for the users, to limit the number of visitors to the premises and to protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers.
